sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: AT LEAST 100 PEOPLE ARE FEARED TO HAVE BEEN KILLED IN THE U.S. AFTER TORNADOES TORE THROUGH At least 100 people are feared to have been killed in the US after tornadoes tore through several mid-western states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Six of the victims died when an Amazon warehouse collapsed in Illinois as a result of what commentators are calling one of the largest storm outbreaks in history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: More than 80 people are believed to have died in Kentucky alone, many of them workers at a candle factory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Scores of search and rescue workers are spending the weekend sifting through the rubble of homes and businesses searching for survivors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Observers say a tornado that traveled through parts of western Kentucky may have broken the record for the longest distance ever traveled, as it was tracked touching down for almost 400 kilometers. The last such storm in the region was in March 1925 when a tornado ran over 355 kilometers through Missouri, Illinois and Indiana.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This latest event is all the more remarkable coming in December when colder weather normally limits the impact of tornadoes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: President Joe Biden colder weather normally limits the impact of tornadoes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: President Joe Biden approved an emergency disaster declaration for Kentucky on Saturday and pledged to support all the affected states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: There were strong warnings aimed at Russia on the last day of the G7 summit in the UK as foreign ministers united against Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's amid tensions over the build-up of Russian troops at Ukraine's border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: British Foreign Secretary Liz Truss spoke about huge repercussions if there were to be an invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: World's largest economies are united. We've sent a powerful signal to our adversaries and our allies. We've been clear that any incursion by Russia into Ukraine would have massive consequences for which there would be a severe cost.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We've also shown that we stand for freedom and democracy and the right of people everywhere to live free from oppression.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The US Secretary of State Antony Blinken attended the summit at Liverpool over the deeply concerning troop build-up at Ukraine's eastern border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Other topics of discussions included China's economic policies and nuclear talks with Iran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In the Austrian capital Vienna, tens of thousands of people took part in a protest after the Freedom Party called for demonstrations against mandatory Covid vaccinations and home confinement for those who haven't yet been jabbed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The party's chief, Herbert Kegel, spoke at the rally and joined in the singing of the country's national anthem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: spoke at the rally and joined in the singing of the country's national anthem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Spain, thousands of people also marched peacefully through the centre of Madrid on Saturday in protest against the government's approach to the coronavirus. Protesters, flanked by police vans, held banners reading, Fake Pandemic and I Won't Get Vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And there were similar scenes in Catalonia on Saturday, where thousands turned out on the streets of Barcelona to protest against the introduction of Covid passports in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Close to 90 per cent of people eligible for vaccination have received two doses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Cases have risen, but hospitals are coping so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Further north in Luxembourg, several hundred people also protested over the weekend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Covid restrictions have been tightened recently to include an obligatory health pass for access to leisure and hospitality premises to prove vaccination or recent recovery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Over the weekend, torrential rain hit the southwest of France causing some rivers to overflow their banks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Authorities evacuated dozens of residents.

sentences.sentence: The flooding was aggravated by unseasonable melted snow banks in the Pyrenees Mountains caused by warm winds from the south.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At least four people are dead and more missing after a gas explosion in Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It happened in the small Sicilian town of Ravenusa as a result of a gas leak in a pipeline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Three buildings collapsed in the blast but fortunately few people were inside at the time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Officials from Italy's civil protection unit said rescue workers found four bodies at the weekend and were still searching for another seven people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They added that a further 50 people had been moved out of the building over safety concerns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, La Cumbre Vieja on the Canary Island of La Palma marked 85 days of continuous activity, becoming the longest time a volcano has been erupting on the island since records began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On September 19, the volcano began spewing out lava and toxic gases that has severely disrupted life on the small Atlantic enclave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: More than 1,200 hectares of land and up to 3,000 buildings have been destroyed by molten rock streams.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Sunday, after several days of low-level activity, the volcano suddenly came alive again, blowing a vast cloud of ash high into the sky.
